description: Hewlett-Packard developed the HP-GL and introduced it in 1977 when it released the HP-9872 plotter. It soon became a standard for plotters to print vector images, most prominently CAD drawings, such as engineering designs and architectural blueprints. Because of its prominent use in CAD environments, many CAD software packages support the format.
NOTE: Hewlett-Packard replaced HP-GL with Hewlett-Packard Graphics Language/2 (HP-GL/2).
